results.title: Philippines No Choice but Change
results.brief_description: This film looks at the events, issues and opposition movement behind the fall of the Marcos dictatorship through the eyes of its participants including Cory Aquino, nuns, priests, lawyers, workers, farmers and guerilla fighters. Filmed all over the country, it shows why millions of Filipinos were swept into the fight for freedom.

results.title: Phantom of the Opera
results.creator_credit: Al Guest, Jean Mathieson and Emerald City Productions
results.brief_description: In the eaves, the tunnels, the trap doors and the back stairs of the Paris Opera House a menacing figure watches. Captivated by the beautiful diva, Christine, the Phantom of the Opera is trapped by his hideous appearance hidden behind his cloak and mask. A beautifully animated adaptation of the ageless classic tale for children of all ages.

results.title: Phantom from 10,000 leagues
results.creator_credit: Dan Warner, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Curious title, considering the phantom rarely lurks deeper than six feet or so underwater. Kent Taylor and Rodney Bell are investigating several mysterious underwater deaths, supposedly caused by a sea “phantom.” The pair suspect that a professor of oceanography (Michael Whalen) knows something about the phantom, which he most certainly does. The phantom, a mutated sea monster, is the result of the professor’s evil experiments with an “atomic ray.” Both villain and phantom (which looks like an ulcerated beach toy) are dispatched by a few sticks of TNT. Famous for winning a ‘Golden Turkey’ award.

results.title: Philby, Burgess & Maclean
results.creator_credit: Gordon Flemyng, Jeremy Wallington and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description: During the 1950’s the world was shocked by the defection to the Soviet Union of Guy Burgess and Donald Maclean, highly placed officials in the diplomatic service. Years later with the web slowly closing around him, Kim Philby defected also. Although in line for the Number Two job in the British Secret Service, he was also a full colonel in the KGB, whom he had secretly served throughout his career. This excellent dramatisation recreates the factual evidence which stunned a nation

results.title: Peter Pan (Disney) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Clyde Geronimi, Hamilton Luske, Wilfred Jackson, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Disney’s well-loved version of the Sir James M. Barrie play. The Darling children are taken on a series of wonderful adventures to Never-never Land. Their guide is the daring and magical Peter Pan who refuses to ever grow up. Along with Peter and his gang of Lost Boys, assisted by the beautiful fairy Tinkerbell, the Darling children do battle against the wicked Captain Hook to save Never-never Land from his evil plans. Beautifully animated and featuring the voices of Bobby Driscoll and Kathryn Beaumont.

results.title: Peter Pan
results.brief_description: Wendy Darling awakes one night to discover Peter Pan searching for his shadow. She helps him to find it, sews it back on and in return Peter and fairy, Tinker Bell teach the children to fly.

results.title: Phar Lap: the people's champion [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Eddie Carnana, Michael Dickinson, Rhett Kirkwood and Hall of Fame Corporation
results.brief_description: The People’s champion, Phar Lap, is an icon of Australia’s past. This video contains previously unseen footage of the greatest thoroughbred there ever was. Footage is contributed featuring Tommy Woodcock, Harry Telford and American businessman David Davis, as well as including the amazing story of Cups King Bart Cummings, whose record 10 Melbourne Cup triumphs is equally worthy of praise.

results.title: Driller killer [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Abel Ferrara, D Metrov, Rochelle Weisberg and Navaron Productions
results.brief_description: In retrospect, the notoriety surrounding Abel Ferrara’s early feature might have had more to do with the film’s provocative title than the content itself. At the time however, “Driller killer” became the scapegoat for the 80s ‘Video nasty’ hysteria, which saw the film unfairly lumped with other exploitation films such as “I spit on your grave” and “Blood sucking freaks.” Subsequently the film was either banned outright in some countries (including the UK), or severely modified for many years. Over the years however the film has enjoyed a renaissance of sorts mainly due to Ferrara’s growing reputation as a filmmaker. The grungy low budget look and punk sensibility of “Driller killer” is a perfect match for this story of a New York artist (played by Ferrara under the pseudonym Jimmy Laine) gradually driven insane. His only recourse from the insistent noise and chaos of the New York streets is to power tool anyone that gets in his way. Ferrara’s films, full of spiritual torment and redemption through bloodletting have seen the director compared to fellow New Yorker Martin Scorsese. With “Driller killer” however, its spiritual doppelganger ends up being Roman Polanski’s disturbing tale of madness, “Repulsion.” There’s even a perverse homage to the skinned rabbit from that film. Cast includes: Carolyn Marz, Baybi Day and Harry Schultz.

results.title: Petroleum's progress
results.creator_credit: Tom Fletcher, Jerry Krepakevich, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Archival footage and commercials provide a history of oil and oil by-products, and of the creation of the petro-chemical industry. Man has developed a frightening dependence on oil. Not only do oil by-products keep him warm and mobile, they help to feed, clean, clothe and entertain him. The film makes the point that there is yet no substitute for oil.
